CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 25, 1962, pg. 9, reads: "Dzaaling D.I.'s - Wearing gowns styled alike, but in different hues, the dazzling members of the well-known D.I. Lub are pictured after being presented during intermission at their fabulous Pearl Bailey benefit cabaret at the Holiday House, Aug. 12. The club presented $500 to The Courier's Charles (Buggsy) Drafts Fund, with the balance to go to the National Fund for Medicine to End Nervous Diseases (MENDS).  Left to right: Margaret Watson, president; Nellye Barron, secretary; Gloria Grate, treasureer; Juanita Drake, financial secretary and chairman of the event; Evelyn Christian, publicity chairman; Mary Jean Eaton, ticket chairman; Birdie Dunlap, associate member, and Ida Jones, associate member. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of D. I. Club members, from left: Margaret Watson, unknown, Gloria Golden Grate, Juanita Drake, Evelyn Jones, unknown, Birdie Dunlap, and Ida Jones, standing in Holiday House for "Pearl Bailey Revue" benefit for MENDS, another version
CatSubject_tab: Clothing and dress--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Women--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Delightfully Insane Club Inc.Holiday House (Monroeville, Pa).Charities--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Grate, Gloria Golden.
